name: gesso
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a mixture of plaster (= a substance that becomes hard and smooth as it dries) and glue, used in painting, sculpture, and as a base for decorating wood: Each canvas was layered with two coats of gesso and painted with watered acrylic. It's a male torso done in pencil on white gesso. Many antique looking-glass frames are made of wood with gilded gesso mouldings.
More examplesFewer examplesShe returned to painting, with soft acrylic washes thinly applied over eight coats of gesso in pinks, blues and yellows. He applies eight coats of gesso and sands between each coat.For my final layer, I apply the gesso with a palette knife. A "santo" as an object means a religious figure carved of wood, covered with gesso, carved in detail, and then painted.
